DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: CS: A string of characters with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant consisting of Upper Case, 0-9, SPACE, Underscore. [Standard-based]_Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Dose calculated for one or more Beams within RT Plan.
Dose calculated for one or more Brachy Application Setups within RT Plan
Dose calculated for a single Fraction Group within the RT Plan
Dose calculated for 2 or more RT Plans
Dose calculated for entire RT Plan
Dose calculated for one or more Control Points within a Beam.
